```Starting from version 0.3.5, if you would like to avoid the path rewrite above, you can set the helm chart value of jsonApiServerPathPrefix to be /api/json-api in the participant-values.yaml file when you are setting up your validator node.```

text:
Hi <@U04UQLMNXV1> <@U01DARYACCT> the restore worked as expected on Friday and we have both original and restore nodes running healthy on Friday. Later I've deleted the Kubernetes cluster on which restored node was running and it also took down the `validator-app` deployment on original cluster as well. Now we are trying to again do the restore but both the `participant` and `validator-app` are having errors especially `participant` pod has the below error:
```{"@timestamp":"2025-05-12T17:57:25.671Z","@version":"1","message":"The sequencer subscriptions have been closed. Closing sequencer client. Close reason: Success(UnrecoverableError(handler returned error: ApplicationHandlerException(\n  first sequencer counter = 40,\n  last sequencer counter = 75,\n  java.lang.IllegalStateException: Mediator approved a request that we have locally rejected```
We are looking to reset the node now. So just wanted to know for `nodeIdentifier` , do we need to provide the value used for restore or the original value we used during the install? We used `nodeIdentifier`  value as `chata-dev-1`  during initial install and `chata-dev-1-restore` during testing the restore install.

I believe will still need to keep `validatorPartyHint`  same but this answers on what value `nodeIdentifier` is needed for the upgrade of the node that was installed using restore process.

text:
Hi Team, the restore worked as expected on Friday and we have both original and restore nodes running healthy on Friday. Later I've deleted the Kubernetes cluster on which restored node was running and it also took down the `validator-app` deployment on original cluster as well. Now we are trying to again do the restore but both the `participant` and `validator-app` are having errors especially `participant` pod has the below error:
```{"@timestamp":"2025-05-12T17:57:25.671Z","@version":"1","message":"The sequencer subscriptions have been closed. Closing sequencer client. Close reason: Success(UnrecoverableError(handler returned error: ApplicationHandlerException(\n  first sequencer counter = 40,\n  last sequencer counter = 75,\n  java.lang.IllegalStateException: Mediator approved a request that we have locally rejected```
We are looking to reset the node now. So just wanted to know for `nodeIdentifier` , do we need to provide the value used for restore or the original value we used during the install? We used `nodeIdentifier`  value as `chata-dev-1`  during initial install and `chata-dev-1-restore` during testing the restore install.

I believe will still need to keep `validatorPartyHint`  same but this also answers on what value `nodeIdentifier` is needed for the upgrade of the node that was installed using restore process. Below are the screenshots attached for the values we used during initial install and node restore

• Identities dump should have "id" set to participant which is currently hosting the party

text: Original party can still be restored to a new node if id in the dump is updated to match the party id which is currently hosting the party on the network (participant id hosting the party is is recorded in the network topology state)
